documents.document: It's hard to believe that it's only Thursday.
@MikeIsaac How do you find out about people unfollowing you?
@asadotzler Really appreciate the help!
@asadotzler Weird, I did the "refresh" and now it works like normal. No idea what the problem was.
@asadotzler I have not tweaked about:config recently. Any easy way to do a "factory reset" on those or see what I've changed?
@asadotzler Actually, they seem to not be loading at all. (Firefox on the left, Chrome on the right) https://t.co/pi3mS42AoQ
@asadotzler Only add-on enabled is Recap. https://t.co/t5WsCseU1i
@asadotzler Example tweet: https://t.co/tryiNX11j6 https://t.co/u1s5typqEV
@binarybits @asadotzler Whereas in Chrome it shows up on top of the existing page.
@binarybits @asadotzler And clicking on a tweet embedded in another tweet causes a new page to open.
@asadotzler https://t.co/1ua401lRUi. Twitter cards seem to load slowly.
@binarybits @pjdoland @brian_carnell It's not like I totally boycott leading products but I like to increase diversity at the margin.
@brian_carnell I try to avoid using popular products, and Chrome's market share is getting really high.
Just started using Firefox for the first time in years. For some reason Twitter web client experience is much worse on Firefox.
@jon_naz @mattyglesias More precisely, it would stop nutritionists from taking kickbacks from french fry makers.
Trump's argument *for* reversing the fiduciary rule is that it's like putting more unhealthy food on menus. https://t.co/DO3ROc4bji
@DearSplenda OK, I think we're on the same page then.
@DearSplenda Yes, I understand the concept. But under this logic people should be deleting Lyft too right?
@DearSplenda How does paying drivers less encourage them to break the strike? That makes no sense.
@DearSplenda You can say that they should have cancelled JFK pickups altogether, but Lyft didn't do that.
@DearSplenda I don't understand what you mean by "using it." Disabling surge pricing likely meant fewer pickups.
@madjayhawk Random acts of violence are bad.
@MattSepara What makes you think he knew it was coming?
@WillOremus I agree with you.
Whoa how did no one tell me that there's a podcast that regularly features the @reihan experience? https://t.co/xR8vci3Lfg
@ComradeVeidt @ddayen Is he talking about me or the protestors? It's not clear.
@Errorreporrt Scalia's Brand X dissent was great.
@shuls13 @voxdotcom @awprokop @DLind Guys, it's time for some game theory.
Liberals are learning from the Tea Party. https://t.co/QCMaDiufKQ
@Scott_Radcliffe Yes, we will have to see.
@Scott_Radcliffe Sasse has said a lot of stuff. Has he cast any anti-Trump votes?
@moral_hazard @mattyglesias I think both parties will wind up more polarized than they were in 2009.
@dchetson @mattyglesias And partisan polarization makes it less likely Congress can stop Trump from starting a war.
@CalebWatney I think it's a rounding error, but at the margin it probably makes governance worse.
@Scott_Radcliffe And Democrats are under pressure to obstruct everything Trump does, "overreach" or not.
@Scott_Radcliffe But Republicans are sticking by their guy.
@Scott_Radcliffe If *Republicans* start pushing back against executive overreach, that would be a positive sign.
@Scott_Radcliffe No, that is not the argument.
@mattyglesias I thought that before the election, but I underestimated how much Trump would galvanize liberals.
Trump is causing the left to organize like the Tea Party, making the democracy-is-doomed case ever more convincing. https://t.co/haNdiEwwLV
@mims @JasonKuznicki I assume he means it gives the Trump administration a ton of power.
This was hard to read. https://t.co/1oSsuaSeUK https://t.co/2zlBdqCTcP
The Republican party has changed a lot in the last 16 years. https://t.co/Rmmf5HDNJi
@MattSepara You should just pin this tweet for the next 4 years.
I think it would be bad for the US military to invade Mexico. https://t.co/DDExm6BMex https://t.co/IKV0QDefVJ
@apblake @ErrataRob Right, I don't understand why the protestors would think that was better.
@ErrataRob That is nutty.
Did Lyft change its policy about JFK pickups during this weekend's protests?
@bergmayer Seems like that could work both ways. Maybe an agency is stuck with its first interpretation until Congress acts.
@bergmayer Immigration law seems equally bizarre if the Gutierrez-Brizuela case is any indication.
@bergmayer It seems more problematic to allow agencies to reverse themselves or the courts based on policy concerns.
@bergmayer It's one thing to say courts should follow an agency's lead the first time an issue comes up.
@bergmayer One thing that concerns me here is the low threshold for agencies to change their minds and/or over-rule courts.
@bergmayer But it seems to me that letting the FCC decide has created a lot of mischief.
@bergmayer My view on this is heavily colored by Brand X for obvious reasons.
So far I'm finding Judge Gorsuch's case for Chevron skepticism pretty persuasive.
@alittlelilypad @germanrlopez That is my view for sure.
@jacobgrier yes, that seems to be the majority position.
There's a bitter feud over coffee flavors going on at the Vox Media DC office right now. French vanilla partisans are on the defensive.
@Lee_Ars The high priority button is an anti-signal. I've never received a high-priority email that was actually high priority.
To be fair, Douglass did do an amazing job. https://t.co/zJMo2G58ZR
@CommonplaceBiz But opposition to Chevron deference could also cause him to be an unpredictable swing vote.
@CommonplaceBiz I have no idea. Maybe he'll be the lone dissenter.
Though admittedly this is the outcome Justice Scalia wanted.
I'm going to laugh if Justice Gorsuch eliminates Chevron deference and then the courts rule that broadband is a Title II service.
The tech sector is mobilizing against Trump's immigration order. The Chamber of Commerce? Not so much. https://t.co/1fB4KZl8Ys
"People and dinosaurs are shown to scale." https://t.co/zreUXAwMD4
@TheRogue_Elf @voxdotcom I am confused. My article doesn't mention Buzzfeed and I'm not sure what you're talking about.
On the other hand, "I don't impose my own values, I just follow the law as written" is the way to get confirmed by a polarized Senate.
Obviously judges should follow the law when it's clear. But the law is full of phrases that are ambiguous or ask judges for value judgments.
Judge Gorsuch's 2016 CWRU lecture seems substantively vacuous but politically astute. https://t.co/xE4chWrNbE
@catlin201 It is a good reason to write a snarky tweet though!
@catlin201 There are many highly qualified lawyers who aren't appellate judges with JDs from Harvard.
Oh good a Harvard guy. That's what the Supreme Court needs.
@madjayhawk how's that?
@gojomo yes. I mean it is jarring to be compared to turkey at all in this context.
The Chamber of Commerce doesn't seem concerned about Trump's immigration order. https://t.co/byyuITZ6Sp
@vikrum5000 @hyperplanes Wow. I assume they didn't actually draft a lot of 60-year-olds.
@MarketUrbanism right it's a stupid study.
Prediction: trump names Kanye to Supreme Court to neutralize a potential 2020 rival.
@MarketUrbanism Other "IP-intensive" industries: wood products, footware manufacturing, dairy products, beverages.
@MarketUrbanism "KB Home" is a trademark, for example.
Most of the "IP-intensive" industries are ones that rely on trademarks, like grocery stores and residential construction.
I debunked the claim that 40 million jobs are "IP intensive" in 2012. https://t.co/kzsqw4Ki1f It won't die. https://t.co/8GEpBZeI0n
See? Trump is totally normal. https://t.co/tijbAhYES5 https://t.co/BH5aESLLKH
This is the key paragraph of Dell's statement. He favors "immigration reform" but doesn't specifically say he oppos… https://t.co/mWNcnItGpI
I asked Dell about their position on Trump's immigration order. Here's their response. https://t.co/gSz77tDQ74
@jobead The Obama version was the same way.
@mattbraga Where does the link go?
@hyperplanes Like a botched FEMA operation that gets thousands killed, for example.
@hyperplanes I'm imagining something worse than ordinary corruption or incompetence.
@hyperplanes Though in that case maybe the public rallies around the president. Ugh.
@hyperplanes Or we could have like a war with China whose awfulness would be impossible to deny.
@hyperplanes I think there could be a "heck of a job" / "mission accomplished" type moment that galvanizes public opinion.
It's becoming clear that Republican lawmakers won't defect from Trump until he commits a massive blunder that hurts a lot of white people.
@rachelbotsman Hi, are you free for an interview? If so please email tim@vox.com. Thanks.
@sarahjeong Does that make someone more or less in a bubble than not knowing someone with a pickup truck?
It really seems like we're living through the later seasons of a poorly-written political drama. These characters a… https://t.co/EkJ9CPOGVv
@cqwww There's lots I can learn about the topic before the actual order comes out.
Who should I be talking to about Trump's rumored H1-B moves and its effects on business and particularly Silicon Valley?
